intro: Placus humifusa, commonly known as the groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features basal leaves that are spoon-shaped and covered in fine hairs, with small yellow flowers clustered at the base. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
